results.title: Rise
results.creator_credit: Emma Sleath, Australian Film Commission and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: A beautifully filmed series of vignettes about the residents of a Melbourne high-rise public housing estate. Wordlessly, through striking imagery and an effective haunting score, we are invited to contemplate an Australian world populated with people from all over the globe. By celebrating the beauty and uniqueness of the residents’ and their homes, “Rise” emerges as an eloquent and dignified study of contemporary working-class life. This short student film was an international award winner.

results.title: Ripple Rock
results.brief_description: An on-the-spot account of how a shipping hazard on Canada’s west coast was blasted out of existence by the worlds greatest non-atomic explosion. The film shows how the submerged twin peaks of Ripple Rock, in Seymour Narrows between Vancouver Island and the British Columbia mainland, were packed with high explosives through an underwater tunnel, and then blown sky-high. For the first time in history ships could pass back and forth without fear of being caught by the underwater death trap.

results.title: Rip Van Winkle
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton and Billy Budd Films
results.brief_description: A clay-animated adaptation of Washington Irving’s classic tale about a free spirit who preferred telling stories to ploughing the land. Although the townsfolk enjoyed his antics they scorned his lack of such Puritan virtues as thrift and hard work. Suitable for 7-11 years.

results.title: Rip Curl: designing and marketing wetsuits
results.creator_credit: Geoff Russell, Peter Wiseman and Media Australia
results.brief_description: The Rip Curl company based in Torquay, Australia is internationally recognised for its range of wetsuits. This program is ideal for senior secondary students of Design, Textiles, Materials and Technology, and Marketing/Business Management. Topics include how wetsuits work, their design and the ways in which Rip Curl markets its famous product as well as the importance of brand names and logos.

results.title: Rights and reactions
results.brief_description: The issue covered in this video is that of civil rights for gay and lesbian people. The event is the 1986 public hearings in New York City Council Chambers on a proposed local bill to outlaw discrimination on the basis of sexual preference; a Bill which was finally passed. Never before have pro-gay and anti-gay arguments been so passionately and bluntly argued on film.

results.title: Right to Live: Who Decides?(Extract from '7 Waves Away')
results.brief_description: A ship has sunk leaving more people than its one lifeboat can carry. The ship’s officer makes the agonizing decision to sacrifice some lives to save others. The film poses questions about the dimensions of leadership and the morality of making life-and-deaeth decisions about others.

results.title: Right of Privacy
results.creator_credit: Warren Steibel and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: A report on the governmental and business activities which pose a threat to individual privacy today, and the possible elimination of all privacy should the National Data Centre be established. Officials speak out on the need to protect citizens. The National Sata Bank is discussed as a collection of statistics and as a potential threat to individual freedom.
